Description: A segmented pottery dish with two semicircular compartments, one of which is approximately half missing. Made from very coarse Nile siltware, low-fired and black in the centre of the section, with pale brown surfaces. The base is flat.
Curator's comments: Parallels: a larger example, Spencer, A.J., Excavations at Tell el-Balamun 1995-1998. London, 1999, 44 and pl.103, 3. See also British Museum 1888,0601.736 and 1909,1201.22 from Naukratis.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IB.021)
